instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PP1V05_SO: What is PP1V05_SO? This is a typo of PP1V05_S0 When you see PP1V05_SO, assume they meant to type PP1V05_S0.

threads.title: 2879 Milk damage
threads.message:
I found a short on <SIGNAL>PP1V05_SO</SIGNAL>, I pulled L7620 and seen it was on pin 2. So I tried some caps above it and pulled <CHIP>U7600</CHIP>. Short still there. So I injected 1.5V into <CAPACITOR>C7660</CAPACITOR> and see that <CHIP>U1400</CHIP> gets hot first when freeze sprayed. 
I can assume <CHIP>U1400</CHIP> is bad, correct?
I did a USC at different angles also already.

threads.title: 2879 Milk damage
threads.message: What do you consider a short? Resistance to GND?
